subject: Re: [junit] Stop me from being bad: Functional testing w/junit OK?
msgSnippet: ... Good Christ, no. JUnit is a testing framework. It is optimized for Object Testing (similar to unit testing); however, it is just an assertion/test
messageBody:
jlindwall wrote:

> Is it against the laws of nature to do something more then unit
> testing with junit?

Good Christ, no.

JUnit is a testing framework. It is optimized for Object Testing
(similar to unit testing); however, it is just an assertion/test
suite/test runner tool. Use it whatever way makes you productive.

<snip />

> I guess that this is not unit testing because I'm not testing a
> single method's actions.

Don't Test Methods; Test Behaviors. Somewhere, you have to invoke a
single method that says "Do XYZ." Test that method. In so doing, you
discover that testing that method would be easier if it were decomposed
like so, and this responsibility were pushed over there... much easier.
So much the better: testing has improved your design.

> Is it inappropriate to use junit in this way? Is there a better way?

Serious question: why the #$%# do you care whether it is
"inappropriate"? Does it get the job done?

If your question is "Is there a better way?" then that is another
discussion entirely. I advise you to put all that out of your mind,
write some tests, refactor, write some tests, refactor... let the pain
be your guide.

Take care.
